communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents relating to the ongoing case of Tyberius Eaddy, who was arrested in 2011 for crimes of forgery, burglary and aggravated assault.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Current GA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Calendars DOI Demapan,  Broderick, Arendt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All official work calendars or schedules for Angela Demapan, Janel Broderick and/or Jeremy Arendt since January 20, 2025. 

I am a reporter for Public Domain and seek a fee waiver. If that waiver is denied I am willing to pay up to $25.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: FOIL Request – Pedro Hernandez Interrogation & Case Records (Etan Patz Case, 2012)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request – Pedro Hernandez Interrogation & Case Records (Etan Patz Case, 2012)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of all public records related to the investigation, interrogation, and prosecution of Pedro Hernandez, arrested in 2012 for the 1979 disappearance of Etan Patz.
Specifically, I am requesting:

1. All interrogation video and audio recordings of Pedro Hernandez from the NYPD and affiliated departments, including:

Pre-Miranda questioning

Post-Miranda statements

Any internal notes or summaries of those interviews


2. All detective reports, field notes, and memoranda related to his arrest and interviews


3. Communications between the NYPD and the Manhattan District Attorney’s Office concerning:

Admissibility of confessions

Legal strategy or trial preparation


4. Any policy memos or training documents revised or distributed in response to this case


5. Documents or correspondence related to any review, reconsideration, or internal audit following the 2025 appellate court decision overturning Hernandez’s conviction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: CPRA Request – Michael Crowe Case Records (January 1998)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request – Michael Crowe Case Records (January 1998)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am formally requesting access to all available public records relating to the investigation, prosecution, and subsequent dismissal of charges in the case of Michael Crowe, who was interrogated in January 1998 by the Escondido Police Department in connection with the murder of Stephanie Crowe.

 Requested Records:

1. Case files, charging documents, and dismissal filings related to Michael Crowe and co-defendants in the Stephanie Crowe homicide case.


2. Memos, legal briefs, and notes from the suppression hearing where the confession was deemed coerced.


3. Expert witness reports or psychological assessments of the interrogation techniques used.


4. Correspondence and internal discussions between the DA's Office and Escondido Police Department concerning:

The admissibility of the confession

The decision to file or drop charges

Public/media inquiries


5. Training or policy memos reflecting lessons learned from the Michael Crowe case, if available.


6. Any statements or interviews prepared by the DA's Office regarding the exoneration and later developments in the case.

 Request Details:

Subject: Michael Crowe, then age 14

Incident: Interrogated Jan. 21–23, 1998, for the murder of Stephanie Crowe

Outcome: Conviction thrown out; found factually innocent by a judge in 2012

Jurisdiction: San Diego County, California

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: Public Records Request – Interrogation & Investigation Records: Michael Crowe (Stephanie Crowe Murder; Jan 1998)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – Interrogation & Investigation Records: Michael Crowe (Stephanie Crowe Murder; Jan 1998)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to public records relating to the criminal investigation and interrogation of Michael Crowe, age 14, in connection with the murder of his sister, Stephanie Crowe, in January 1998, in Escondido, CA.

Requested Records:

1. Complete video and/or audio recordings of all interrogations of Michael Crowe, including multiple sessions conducted between January 21–23, 1998.


2. Transcripts or written summaries of those interrogations, if available.


3. Interrogation and investigation memos, police reports, indices or logs summarizing the interviews and collection of evidence.


4. Any internal reviews, assessments, or complaints regarding interrogation methods used in connection with the Crowe case.


5. Correspondence relating to media or external inquiries, including any communication with Court TV, Oprah, or other journalists regarding the case.

 Identifying Details:

Incident: Murder of Stephanie Crowe; Michael became the focus of multiple extended interrogations.

Approx. Dates: January 21 through January 23, 1998.

Jurisdiction: Escondido Police Department, San Diego County.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: FOIL Request – Interrogation Records: Adrian P. Thomas Case (August–September 2008) (Troy Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records related to the criminal investigation and interrogation of Adrian P. Thomas, conducted by the Troy Police Department in or around August to September 2008:
Requested Materials:

1. Full-length video and/or audio recordings of all interrogations involving Adrian P. Thomas.


2. Transcripts or written summaries of those interrogations.


3. Incident reports, investigative memos, and officer statements tied to the interrogation.


4. Any internal reviews, training materials, or policy evaluations conducted following the public controversy or court rulings related to this interrogation.


5. Chain of custody or documentation logs verifying authenticity of the video.


6. Any correspondence between the Troy Police Department and the Rensselaer County District Attorney’s Office concerning the handling of Adrian P. Thomas's interrogation and confession.


Additional Information:

Date of Incident: August 28–September 9, 2008

Subject: Adrian P. Thomas, who was interrogated and later had his conviction overturned by the New York Court of Appeals on February 20, 2014.

Case Background: The video of the 9.5-hour interrogation was a critical piece of evidence in the suppression and appeal hearings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: Fort Myers Public Records Request – Records Requests Log

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Fort Myers Public Records Request – Records Requests Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to records showing public records requests received by your agency during the period Jan 1 2025  through date request fulfilled. Specifically, please provide:

A log, spreadsheet, database, or summary (electronic or otherwise) of all public records requests received;

-For each request: the date received, requester’s name , summary of the request, assigned tracking number (if any), and status or final disposition (e.g. fulfilled, denied, pending);

-Any reports, internal summaries, or aggregated data your agency compiles related to public records request volume.

Please produce the records in a machine‑readable format (e.g. CSV or Excel) if available. 

Thank you for your prompt attention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: ORR - Vance Ray Randolph Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding the Vance Ray Randolph, age 22, incident that occurred on June 28, 2025 at 6000 N Terminal Parkway, Atlanta, GA 30320 (Hartsfield‑Jackson Atlanta International Airport). Randolph was arrested on the charges of trafficking marijuana.

Specifically, I am seeking to obtain an electronic copy of the:

1. BWC footage recorded by the arresting Officer detailing his full involvement in this incident. 
2. Incident report.

To assist you in locating the footage here are the key details of the incident:

Court Case Number: 2025WA04020 LK
Date of Event: June 28, 2025
Names: Vance Ray Randolph
Location of Event: 6000 N Terminal Parkway, Atlanta, GA 30320 (Hartsfield‑Jackson Atlanta International Airport)

Please let me know if you require further information to process it.

If any aspects of this request are denied, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and please notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marius Christensen
